paragraph: Gary Thomas (born June 10, 1961) is an American jazz saxophonist and flautist, born in Baltimore, Maryland. He was a member of Jack DeJohnette's Special Edition band and has worked with John McLaughlin, Herbie Hancock, Pat Metheny, John Scofield, Jim Hall, Dave Holland, Greg Osby, Wayne Shorter, Ravi Coltrane, Cassandra Wilson, Wallace Roney, Steve Coleman, and Miles Davis.
Thomas was the Director and Chair of Jazz Studies at Johns Hopkins University in Baltimore.

Until We Love (JMT, 1994)With Sam Rivers' Rivbea All-star Orchestra
The Invisible Hand (Blue Note, 1999)With Ingrid Jensen
Jazz Is a Spirit (ACT, 2002)With Lonnie Plaxico
The Heart Of Things. Live In Paris (Verve, 2000)With Tom Williams
Introducing Tom Williams (Criss Cross, 1991)  With Andrzej Cudzich
